description: Machu Picchu, often referred to as the 'Lost City of the Incas,' is an iconic archaeological site located high in the Andes Mountains. This UNESCO World Heritage site is renowned for its well-preserved ruins and stunning views. Believed to have been built in the 15th century, Machu Picchu served as a royal estate and religious site. The site is surrounded by lush green mountains, and visitors must hike or take a train to reach it. Once there, they can explore the ancient structures, including temples, terraces, and homes, while soaking in the breathtaking natural beauty of the area.

activities: Explore the ruins of Machu Picchu and learn about its historical significance.
Hike the Inca Trail for a multi-day adventure leading to Machu Picchu.
Visit the nearby town of Aguas Calientes for shopping and local cuisine.
Take a guided tour to understand the architecture and culture of the Incas.
Enjoy breathtaking views from Huayna Picchu after a challenging hike.
tips_and_tricks: Purchase tickets to Machu Picchu in advance, especially during peak tourist season.
Acclimatize to the altitude before hiking the Inca Trail.
Bring water, snacks, and sun protection when visiting the site.
Consider hiring a guide for an enriched experience and insights into the history.
